definition: Yongle Emperor, reign name of third Ming emperor Zhu Di 朱棣[Zhu1 Di4] (1360-1424), reigned 1403-1424, Temple name 明成祖[Ming2 Cheng2 zu3]
forever/always/perpetual
music
happy/cheerful/to laugh
surname Yue
surname Le
the Yongle Great Encyclopedia (1408)

sentences.english: From the Yongle Emperor onwards, 13 Ming Dynasty Emperors were buried in this area.
sentences.chinese: 自永乐帝开始，明朝十三陵共埋葬了十三位皇帝。

sentences.english: Search Taobao you to take a look to Paradise Square.
sentences.chinese: 你到淘宝搜永乐坊可以看看去。

sentences.english: Paradise Square, you can search to see.
Yongle's handwriting is the worst among all of us.
sentences.chinese: 在我们当中，永乐的书写是最差的。

sentences.english: What Kinds of Books are Yongle Dadian and Siku Quanshu?
sentences.chinese: 《永乐大典》和《四库全书》是什么样的书？

sentences.english: Liu Yongle was born in Yongchun, Fujian Province in 1945.
sentences.chinese: 刘永乐，1945年出生，福建永春人。

sentences.english: Dr Lo is a specialist in infectious diseases.
sentences.chinese: 劳永乐是感染及传染病专科医生。

sentences.english: This is the statue of Emperor Yongle.
sentences.chinese: 这就是永乐皇帝的塑像。

sentences.english: What do you know about Ming Emperor Yongle?
sentences.chinese: 关于明朝的永乐皇帝你知道些什么？

sentences.english: Zheng he rose to become a trusted official of the Yongle Emperor of the Ming Dinasty.
sentences.chinese: 郑和成为了一位受到明朝永乐皇帝信任的。

sentences.english: The third Emperor Yongle of the Ming Dynasty and his wife Empress Xu were buried in this tomb.
sentences.chinese: 明朝第三位永乐皇帝和他的皇后就埋在此陵。

sentences.english: As early as the Yongle reign of the Ming dynasty, Jingdezhen potters tried the making of architectural ceramics.
sentences.chinese: 明代永乐时期，景德镇陶工就进行了建筑陶瓷的尝试。

sentences.english: The murals in the Yongle Palace total 873 square meters.
sentences.chinese: 永乐宫内璧画的总体面积达873平方米。

sentences.english: Paradise Square, pure natural "gold series" very suitable aunt use.
sentences.chinese: 永乐坊的纯自然的“纯金系列”很适宜伯母用。

sentences.english: Despite his veneration of violence, Yongle sought to defang certain parts of Ming society.
sentences.chinese: 虽然他尚武，永乐帝还是削弱了明朝社会的某些部分。

definition: Hongwu Emperor, also written Hung-wu Ti, reign name of first Ming emperor Zhu Yuanzhang 朱元璋[Zhu1 Yuan2 zhang1] (1328-1398), reigned 1386-1398, Temple name 明太祖[Ming2 Tai4 zu3]
Xuande Emperor, reign name of fifth Ming emperor Zhu Zhanji 朱瞻基[Zhu1 Zhan1 ji1] (1398-1435), reigned 1426-1436, Temple name 明宣宗[Ming2 Xuan1 zong1]
Hongzhi Emperor, reign name of ninth Ming emperor 朱祐樘[Zhu1 You4 tang2] (1470-1505), reigned 1487-1505, Temple name 明孝宗[Ming2 Xiao4 zong1]
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
Zhengde Emperor, reign name of eleventh Ming emperor Zhu Houzhao 朱厚照[Zhu1 Hou4 zhao4] (1491-1521), reigned 1505-1521, Temple name 明武宗[Ming2 Wu3 zong1]
Jianwen Emperor, reign name of second Ming Emperor Zhu Yunwen 朱允炆[Zhu1 Yun3 wen2] (1377-1402), reigned 1398-1402
Tianshun Emperor, reign name of eighth Ming Emperor 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1457-1464, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
Ming Chengzu, Temple name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Jingtai county in Baiyin 白銀|白银[Bai2 yin2], Gansu/Jiangtai Emperor, reign name of seventh Ming Emperor Zhu Qiyu 朱祁鈺|朱祁钰[Zhu1 Qi2 yu4] (1428-1457), reigned 1449-1457, Temple name 代宗[Dai4 zong1]
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)
tomorrow morning/the following morning
the early Ming (i.e. from second half of 14th century)
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
Ming Taizu, Temple name of first Ming emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
Temple name of fifth Ming emperor Xuande 宣德[Xuan1 de2]
Ming Wuzong, temple name of eleventh Ming emperor Zhengde 正德[Zheng4 de2]
the Ming dynasty (1368-1644)
